column5: Encapsulates everything a business or an organization does to put customers first, managing their journeys and serving their needs.

column8: The process by which GTI delivers exceptional seamless and personalised omni-channel customer experiences

column11: The design and development of customer journeys across all inbound and outbound channels and customer touchpoints.

The tailoring of individual customer journeys and application of personalised content, which may or may not relate to a campaign based on customer interaction and broader insight. Determines in real-time a next best action e.g. product recommendation based upon customer activity in the channel.

A place where a business sells goods in person. From traditional freestanding brick-and-mortar stores to mall space, the best retail location is in a high-traffic area where your potential customers are known to shop.
The capture and analysis of information related to the level of engagement of a customer or set of customers.
The transmission of information with customers to produce a specific outcome; mostly informational communications
Channel management is about coordinating a mix of internal channels, such as proprietary retail and e-commerce, and third-party sellers

column8: Registration, authentication and management of a customer's information to enable use of our services.

column11: Enables us to securely capture and manage customer digital recognition data, facilitates federated identity, allows us to control customer access to applications and services & allows us to verify a persons identity online.

Unifies all of our 1st party customer data (both master data & transactional data) into a 360 view, using algorithms to match profiles from multiple systems of record.  Data can be enriched by 3rd party Identity Graphs.

Enables a retail or healthcare customer to register to use any of our services both online or offline, to provide & maintain personal / demographic information including consents & preferences, 'non-core' information such as favourite brands and 'healthcare' data such as conditions or allergies.

Giving users privacy control, these tools help to build trust and boost user engagement. Helps us balance personalization with privacy, enable compliance with data protection laws, and empower your customers to take control of their data.

column8: Provision of customer support services to ensure customer satisfaction

column11: The provision, deployment and management of surveys and feedback mechanisms to enable the measurement and monitoring of customer satisfaction.

Processes and tools that are used to manage customer contact across and within channels. Includes inbound contact , self serve, automation, routing and queuing of inbound contact and outbound contact, enabling consistent and aligned communication across channels.
Processes and tools that the customer service organization uses to capture, resolve, and report on customer issues. Case management may include workflow, SLA and escalation functionality

A set of process and tools that allow the creation, sharing, use of and management of knowledge and information within the organization. Knowledge Management may be surfaced internally or externally to customers. KM includes the ability to create, approve, workflow and make available Knowledge to end consumers

A set of tools and processes used by the contact center to improve and drive operational efficiency and agent performance through Workforce management, Quality Management, Call recording, Training, and operational insight
To plan, coordinate, and control schedules, tasks, and using various techniques to make time use more efficient.

column8: Manage content and assets, allowing multiple contributors to create, edit, publish and distribute content across channels.

column11: The processes and tools associated the generation, creation and approval of content and  assets for use across multiple channels and campaigns; usually in response to a  brief.
The management of images, templates, forms and other assets, including rules around housekeeping, tagging of the metadata and policy information around rights of use.
Management and regulation of content that is generated and shared by customers, including ratings and review and social media content.

column8: Planning and execution of brand, product and services marketing

column11: Strategy, definition and execution for the positioning of [...] brands in the marketplace to increase brand awareness and customer loyalty
The planning, execution, tracking of a specific marketing initiative. A campaign will typically be associated with an segment and will require creative content
Analysis of campaign effectiveness, through enabling specific conversions. e.g. sales to be attributed to the campaign
The processes and tools that ensure optimal placement of media across all channels to maximise brand awareness.
The process by which individually personalized incentives (coupons, offers, events etc) are allocated to specific customers.

column8: End-to-end management of the ordering and return of products and services

column11: Real time arrangement of visibility of inventory across all selling channels (Stores, online etc)
Determines fulfilment options and selects optimal supply route, considering factors including eligibility rules, delivery calendars, cost to fill, resource capacity, margin maximisation
Manages the end-to-end order lifecycle, including creation, modification, cancellation, splitting, merging, bundling, holding, pre-orders and back-orders.
Management of customer returns, including determining disposition end-to-end lifecycle and re-entry of inventory into the supply chain where possible.

column8: Ability to manage and execute a transaction across multiple channels, including application of relevant pricing, promotions and payment options while managing payments, refunds and receipting.

column11: Provides the ability for a cart to be managed across all channels, including session management, re-use of customer account information, presenting product recommendations, informing of missed promotions, the entry of promo codes, etc.

Calculates the final price of a cart for items across different channels and geographies. Applies promotions and loyalty rewards/offers to a basket, considering exemptions and other basket rules. Includes tax calculation.
Includes payments acceptance, fraud, recurring payments, and management of refunds.
Provides a view/record of the 'transient' transaction, including information of returns and refunds issued. Issued to customers and available for the duration of the refund period.

column8: a set of strategies, techniques, and tools that companies use to attract, engage, and retain customers.

column11: Customer retention strategies that motivate customers to continue buying from a company instead of competitors and delivers insights and helps to build customer relationships by being open, modular, and simple.

Program execution is about setting clear and achievable goals by understanding customers through research in order to offer value, design reward opportunities, plan finances (balance sheet), while monitoring and adjusting where necessary.
A strategy that involves tools and tactics to acquire, engage, and retain customers analyzing customer behavior and feedback to improve customer satisfaction and loyalty.
Managing the customer's attributes that contribute towards points, tiering, spend, subscription services and referrals.

column5: Merchandising across all channels and operations management of stores

column8: The translation of business strategy into a sales and profit plan, and strategic planning of store ranges

column11: Setting of ‘bottom-up’ sales and profit contribution for the year, on weekly, monthly, quarterly basis.
Within store formats (convenience, destination etc), grouping of stores to receive the same product range

column8: Management of the portfolio and new product development of private label and own-brand products

column11: Management of the portfolio of private label and own-brand products
Manage the development lifecycle of new private label and own-brand products

Design of individual store layout to assign category modules to locations, and design of shelf layout (Planogram), publication to stores to enable layout execution and generation of assortments listings which control store ranges.

column8: Determination and management of selling prices, markdown prices and promotions, and the management of commercial rebates from suppliers

The ability to get the correct selling and markdown pricing to every selling channel for subsequent selling activities
Determination of optimized promotional activity, based on promotional strategy.  Simulation forecasting to assist in the planning of promotions.

For every promotional calendar period, manage the process of determining, forecasting and approving the promotions that will be executed.  Set the detailed parameters of the promotion and distribute these to every selling channel for subsequent promotion and selling activities.
Management of supplier/partner contributions for commercial initiatives across retail and pharmacy & healthcare.

column8: Enabling processes for effective management of a store

column11: Co-ordination planning by field leadership of stores operations improvements and interventions e.g audits
Manage store labour budget, forecasting of labour needs, scheduling labour and capturing attendance, and co-ordination management of the lifecycle and day-to-day tasks of store associates.
Manages the ability to communicate corporate instructions to stores in order to execute the merchandize and pricing plans.
Executing and controlling compliance to the changes of price labels, signage and store layout/product display based on new/revised fllorplans and planograms.
Daily reconciliation and handling of cash in the store, and managing bank and safe balances.

The ability to fulfill a customer's order within a store. This includes the pick/pack of an online retail and the store collection/pick up of parcels across all channels (retail, pharmacy, photo, partner, lockers).

The ability to manage the physical inventory within the stores, across Retail front of store and pharmacy. This includes ther local ordering, receiving, transferring, returns, counting/adjustment and shelf management to optimize store inventory levels.

The execution of non-pharmacy consultation services inside the stores including beauty, general wellness/well-being etc.

Provide the means of assembling and dispensing prescriptions for customers that are ready for delivery such as pick up, mail or other parcel delivery services
Provide the means of dispensing drugs, services and products for patients. The lifecycle of multispecialty clinical services such as opticians, hearing and care home are included here.

column8: Delivery of various care services to [...] patients

column11: Management of the complex appointment and scheduling services that allow patients and pharmacists to  book consultations or visits.
Ability to intake and manage new patients and can include adding prescriptions to the appropriate patient.
Execution of pharmacy and healthcare consultations through various channels with a pharmacist or clinician.
Management of lab work from internal pharmacists or network clinicians
Provides the ability to process and administer immunizations along with meeting post administration requirements.
A detailed plan with information about a patient's disease, the goal of treatment, the treatment options for the disease and possible side effects, and the expected length of treatment.
A longitudinal health record comprising 1st party & 3rd party health information relating to a patient. This can include patient health records, EMR, self-reported patient data etc
Population health has been defined as "the health outcomes of a group of individuals, including the distribution of such outcomes within the group.

column8: Management of the administrative processes during the lifecycle of the patient's care with [...]

column11: Define, and maintain over time, information describing the pharmacy products and services that are covered as part of a third-party agreement.

After a bill for services is submitted to the payer of the service (insurance compnay, governements, charities, etc.) the payer determines their financial responsibility for the payment to the provider of the service.
Management of all the 3rd party partners that are billed for pharmacy & healthcare prescriptions, services and products provide to the customer

Management of the government entities that are billed for the pharmacy & healthcare prescriptions, services and products provided to the customer. This includes entities and agreements such as CMS, 340B, NHS and Medicare.

column8: Management of the backend operations to enable the delivery of pharmacy and healthcare services

column11: Management of the store locations that are able to deliver the care to prescriptions and care to patients or partners.

Execute the steps required for data entry and workflow to fill a prescription in a retail, central, or speciality pharmacy.  Steps may include: data entry, data review, work queue management, utilization review, adjudication, filling, and verification, and dispensing.
Ability to accept and manage the insurance providers from the patient
Management of clinicians who will write scripts for patients to receive medication.

Utilization review (UR) is the process of reviewing an episode of care. The review confirms that the insurance company will provide appropriate financial coverage for medical services. The UR process and the UR nurse facilitate minimizing costs. This will include drug, medical or mental health servics.

Monitoring of Outcomes to assess patient adherence / compliance. Includes Medication Therapy Management (MTM), and Walgreens Advanced Care Program. MTM is an adherence program that allows pharmacist interventions that assist patients in reaching or exceeding adherence goals (PDC) by the end of the calendar year. Patients eligible for the Adherence Monitoring program have either become non-adherent or at risk of becoming non-adherent and benefit from ongoing consultations with a pharmacist.  Walgreens Advanced Care program which proactively addresses adherence issues by reaching out to patient for support if needed.
provides clinicians, staff, patients or other individuals with knowledge and person-specific information, intelligently filtered or presented at appropriate times, to enhance health and health care.
Ability to manage compliance of a patient's prescription, medical device use, self care with compliance to local and national regulations

column5: Planning and operation of the business supply network

column8: The management of the forecasting and capacity constraints of the enterprise as related to physical goods

column11: Continuous alignment and synchronization among all functions of the organization, ensuring plans across commercial, supply , operations and finance are continuously aligned and optimised

Forecasting the demand (sales) for products over time increments reflecting historic analysis inventories, seasonality and projected growth etc. Creation of predicted supply forecast taking into consideration vendor capacity  in order to satisfy the needs of the demand plan.
The process of determining the production capacity needed by an organization to meet changing demands for its products, and required materials to support planned production.
The process of determining the factory capacity needed by an organization to meet changing demands for its products.

column8: The management of the replenishment activities for the enterprise, including optimizing inventory levels and allocating products

column11: Develop optimal inventory levels and flow strategies that balance capital constraints / objectives and service level goals while taking demand and supply volatility into account, developing and implementing system settings to optimize inventory investment while driving sales and in stock improvements.

Set up and manage allocations to distribute stock (a "Push" method) to locations and setting up further allocations to maintain stock.  May be used in conjunction with replenishment to manage stock levels.  Also included are processes to manage allocation changes as a result of seasonal or planning calendar events, which could influence demand.

Create and execute a time-phased order plan to maintain optimal inventory levels and flow strategies for the distribution centers based on demand forecasts, supply volatility, current inventory, seasonal inventory entry/exits, promotions and other initiatives.

Create and execute a time-phased order plan to maintain product inventories at individual stores based on demand forecasts, current inventory, planned resets, seasonal inventory entry/exits, promotions and other initiatives.
The management of catalogues and the requisition, approval and ordering process for Goods Not for Resale products and services.

column8: The management of the operations of the physical warehouses

column11: Plan for current and future labor needs of the distribution center, forecasting labor needs, scheduling labor, analyzing scheduling and attendance and utilization, and managing to warehouse labor budget.

Direction for warehouse staff and non-human workers (robots/autonomous machines) to perform tasks such as stocking, picking, quality control, packing etc.  Optimization and prioritization of warehouse tasks in alignment with inventory needs.
The process of coordinating and tracking truck movements within the yard, before, during and after loading/unloading.

column8: The management of the capabilities required to support the transportation of all goods (including controlled drugs and hazardous materials) from the company's distribution network

column11: This process includes development and maintenance of network strategy by optimizing warehouse and transport hub geographical locations. It includes selection of distribution centers utilization in order to optimize efficiency and flexibility, development of flow strategy by selection and optimization of transport mode utilization, inventory holding nodes, and flow path optimization.

This process includes monitoring, forecasting, and managing inventory flow through all distribution facilities by developing tools and processes to support timely product delivery including event and exception management. It also involves capabilities to provide real-time visibility, in-transit updates, and generating exception alerts with event status throughout supply chain (i.e. at delivery location, unloaded, departing delivery location, etc.) and managing and forecasting capacity of distribution facilities and transport lanes.

All activities associated with selecting and managing transport carriers, including: defining selection criteria, evaluating carriers, selecting carriers, managing carrier contracts and relationships.

Covers all activities associated with managing company owned or leased transportation assets, spanning both fleet management (commercial arrangements, acquisition etc.) was well as maintenance (performance tracking, mechanical maintenance, fuel and driver management)

Management of import purchase orders including duty calculations, import purchase order attributes, letters of credit, estimated landed cost calculation. It also includes import logistics tracking to provide visibility to import movements (e.g. booking, bill of lading, etc.), monitoring production, and managing production timing and actions for private label products.

Ability to move products backwards through the supply chain to original vendor or for disposal (destroy, salvage, donate), returns processes includes the ability to deal with products that came from Direct Ship Vendors and Drop to Marketplace, and it includes establishing product return and disposal rules, and designating a product for return to vendor or disposal.
The ability to fulfill the delivery of customer parcels from warehouse, store or other central facilities, using internal delivery network or 3rd party carriers/couriers.

column8: The management of the overall [...] strategic initiatives including current and future subsidiaries and/or lines of business

column11: Ability to engage in strategic decision making by looking across all of the business units to determine how to create the most value. There should be a consideration on how the various businesses interact/inter-relate with each other in terms of human resources, processes, technology, information and governance

Ability to strategize the set of innovations, product developments, investments etc. to fund or not to fund - to achieve business objectives. This is more broadly related to the portfolio or lines of businesses as opposed to the IT Portfolio Management of applications

Evaluation and execution of merger and acquisition deals, including: financial and legal structure of the deal; financial value of assets and forecast business impacts; and any government, regulatory, commercial or labor considerations.

column8: The management of core financial activities from budgetary planning to reporting and reconciliation

column11: Define the company’s financial goals, generally over the next three to five years.  Define the funding allocated, by operating unit, to support achieving these goals.  Communicate the plan and budget appropriately throughout the company.

Record, summarize, analyze and report on all financial transactions and balances.  Includes the general ledger of accounts, balance sheets, income statements, cash flow statements, and reconciliation of GL accounts.

Includes the broad spectrum of general accounting activities and management of financial accounts which would be used for reporting such as: General Ledger (GL), Accounts Payable/Receivable (AP/AR), Reconcialiation, Travel & Expenses, Payroll etc. Intercompany accounting of recording financial transactions between different legal entities within the same parent company would also reside here.

Ability to track the location, quantity, condition, maintenance and depreciation status, etc. of a company's fixed assets for financial accounting and reporting.  A fixed asset is not purchased with the intent of immediate resale, but rather for productive use within the entity. Examples - Buildings, Computer Equipment, Land, Vehicles, HVAC Systems, etc.

The ability to define, manage and oversee policies and procedures related to cash management, bank accounts, debts and investments.  Mitigate company exposure to financial risk, including: foreign exchange risk, market risk, credit and liquidity risk, etc.

The ability for the company to manage its financial services and credit card offerings between partners as well as customers. This includes firm offers such as own branded credit/debit card, Walgreens Cash, Gift Cards etc.
Develop foreign, national, state, and local tax strategy.  Manage tax liabilities, and ensure that appropriate taxing authorities receive tax filings and payments when due.

Create financial reports specifically designed to track the financial progress of projects.  To be used by managers as an aid in project management, and finance analysts for financial planning and controls.

column8: The management and support of capabilities related to laws the company operates under, the legal agreements entered into, and the regulations that need to be followed

column11: The ability to monitor and respond appropriately to changes in the legislative or regulatory landscape as it applies to [...]'s operations
Manage internal and external audit functions to investigate and report on the existence and effectiveness of policies, procedures and control mechanisms over key company functions and risks.
Manage relationships between company management and various government and industry groups that regulate, oversee, or otherwise potentially affect the company's business or business environment.
Manage the lifecycle of contracts as well as the relationships with the partners by the company. This includes renewal, dismissal and legal action as required depending on the terms.

Define and oversee policies and procedures for managing company information throughout its life cycle, from the time of creation or inscription to its eventual disposition.  Includes identifying, classifying, storing, securing, retrieving, tracking and destroying or permanently preserving physical and electronic documents and other records.

column8: The management of human capital through their full lifecycle

Ability to measure and manage individual and team performance, link individual and team performance to organizational goals and mission statements.  Enable line managers to carry out staff performance appraisal responsibilities.

Design and execute compensation programs that attract, retain and compensate employees in a fair and competitive manner.  Includes determination of eligibility for both monetary and non-monetary incentives such as performance-based bonuses and service awards.
Collect and report employee and contractor working hours and paid non-working hours (vacation, sick, etc).  Generally for use in payroll, benefits determination, and contract labor payments.
Ability to manage, retain, and dispose of human resource records (both paper & electronic) in accordance with corporate policies, and to manage reporting supporting Human Resources functions.
Develop and maintain plans to ensure a continuous flow of qualified candidates to fill critical positions.

Manage information and communications between company management and the general public to maintain its image and position within the communities served, as well as internal communications to employees from company management.
Ability to take responsibility for the impacts of business operations and develop strategies on society and environmental issues.

Maintenance and upkeep of the facilities and its assets owned by the business. For example: HVAC repairs, leaks, light fixture changes etc

Manage property lease portfolio - manage payment obligations, receive and resolve notifications, lease renewals, reporting for financials and management.

Knowledge an enterprise gains from analyzing sets of information pertaining to a given topic or situation that provides understandings that help the business make informed decisions and reduces risks.

Manages the complex relationships and processes related to a company’s production recipes.

itration is a way to limit potential side effects by taking time to see how your body will react to a drug. In titration, the medication is started at a low dose. Every couple of weeks, the dose is raised (“up-titrated”) until the maximum effective dose (“target dose”) has been achieved or side effects occur.itration is a way to limit potential side effects by taking time to see how your body will react to a drug. Every couple of weeks, the dose is raised (“up-titrated”) until the maximum effective dose (“target dose”) has been achieved or side effects occur.

Practices and tools that join financial, contractual and inventory functions to support life cycle management and strategic decision making for the IT environment.  Assets include all elements of software and hardware in the estate.

Management of the organization's deployment of automation tools such as RPA, Power Apps and ensuring their productivity, effectiviness and optimization

column8: Development and deployment of new products, services and solutions for the organization

column11: Ability to provide a comprehensive solution of information technologies – based on both custom-developed or commercial products and services - to effectively and efficiently deliver business critical applications and information
Ability to link together separate IT systems, services and/or software to enable all of them to share data, events, and to work functionally together.

Deployment of the various technology solutions either developed in house or sourced from a partner. This includes set up of physical devices, connection to network or configuration of applications ready to be consumed by users

Management of the principles, framework and tools necessary to optimize the organization's ability to deliver applications and technology services with the speed, agility and flexibility required to delivery business value

column8: The support and operations of IT products, services and solutions to the business

column11: Ensures on-going availability and quality of IT services through Incident, Problem, Change, configuration and Request (including Service Desk) management.

Definition and management of Business, Application, Data, and Technology portfolios for the enterprise.  Provide oversight for the acquisition and usage of the enterprise's technology, data, and application assets with responsibility for assuring their appropriate and secure usage.

Ability to provide all support needed to keep the technology environment and business applications operating at expected service levels.
Monitor the routine operation of IT systems to assure proper funciton, schedule recurring processes, and restore normal operations in the event of common failures. Includes data center facilities management.

column8: Oversight of the strategic imperatives IT needs to operate and support busines needs

column11: Management of the portfolio of all the tools and services within the IT organization and providing strategic guidance on the investments, projects and activities
Oversight of the expenditures, budgeting and requests required to deliver IT products, services and solutions to the organization
Ability to project, monitor respond to the fluctuation of capacity requirements of IT products, services and soutions

Manage interactions between IT and its clients to: align on objectives, assure the effective sharing of requirements and capabilities, coordinate project and support activities and promote trust and a positive working relationship. The demand for the service can be from customer (C4IT) or technology (IT4IT)

column8: The management of all the operational requirement to utilize data as an asset for users and business needs

column11: Describe how data is collected, stored, transformed, distributed and consumed. Includes rules governing structured formats, such as databases and file systems, the tools for analyzing and reporting data.

Maintain, monitor, and manage data to provide control data as an asset, as well as their processing and interactions with different applications and business processes. Ensure that the entire life cycle of data use and processing is on par with company objectives.
Development and maintenance of the physical and virtual infrastructure supporting the end to end automation of data between systems internal and external to the organization
Ability for the organization to combine multiple sources of data into a single unified view that can be utilized for business needs
Management of the suite of tools and technologies that enable data to be used as an asset for the organization
Development, acquisition and innovation of advanced use cases for Big Data technologies such as artificial intelligence and machine learning

column8: The management, response and mitigation of risks to the organization's information and technology assets

column11: Processes and tools for identifying, authenticating and authorizing individuals or groups of people to have access to applications, systems or networks by associating user rights and restrictions with established identities.
Manage risk and protect critical information assets from intrusions, security incidents and data loss, includes secure configurations for systems and project support.
Manage the risk and protect non-physical assets which support the organization including installation of preventative measures and rapid response to threats

Monitoring and assessment of external or internal facing threats or vulnerabilities that can jeopardize the operations of the business. Includes the preventative and responsive measures to minimize these risks before and when they occur.

column5:
Sustainability, Environment, Social and Governance Management - Topics to consider:
Current employees’ happiness, rights, representation, and quality of life
Waste produced annually
Carbon emission levels
Toxins used in the manufacturing process
Volunteerism and civic engagement
Waste and toxins created in the product life cycle
Required infrastructure to support sustainable practices

Marketing management involves developing and implementing strategic marketing programs, processes, and activities that align with wider business objectives, while utilizing customer insights, tracking metrics, and optimizing internal processes to achieve success.

column8: Campaign management is the process of planning, executing, tracking, and optimizing marketing campaigns to achieve business objectives. It can also refer to managing political campaigns. The goal is to ensure that marketing efforts deliver measurable results and maximize ROI.

Target management is the process by which creating and implementing a marketing strategy that breaks a market for segments and then concentrates marketing efforts on one or a few key segments consisting of the customers whose needs and desires most closely match your product or service offerings. It can be the key to attracting new business, increasing sales, and making your business a success.
